intro: Didymosperma engleri, commonly known as the Engler's didymosperma, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems, typical of many species in its family. It typically grows in forested areas and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface, contributing to its ecological adaptability.
